pageContext.claim: “As you know, Dr. Fauci, a good guy, said, 'You don't need to do [a travel ban].'”
pageContext.analysis: At an April 13 news conference, Fauci said “The travel [restriction] was another recommendation, when we went in and said, ‘We probably should be doing that.’ And the answer was ‘yes.’ And then another time was, ‘We should do it with Europe,’ and the answer was ‘yes.’ And the next time, ‘We should do it with the U.K.,’ and the answer was ‘yes.’” Moreover, {according to a New York Times report}, Fauci supported measures to ban travel to the pandemic's epicenter.
